instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, No Green Light, PPBUS 8.17v
threads.message:
Was hoping this would be a <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>/SMC/J9500 issue, but it's not proving to be that simple.

This board came from a customer unit that was an Apple refurbished piece of garbage, and the board failed in the unit. I notice the board has been repaired from significant liquid in the past (repairs look old, covered in dust, etc), but the symptoms are confusing me:

1. PPBUS was 8.17v and no green light; no shorts on ppbus or 3v42. I checked <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and then moved onto replacing the SMC.

2. Replaced SMC, and issues persist.

3. I inspected J9500 very, very well, and no issues found.

4. Replaced SMC again, issue remains.

5. Measurements at <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> are all correct and steady.

I'm not sure what else to check at this point. Unit does not power on from battery either. No green light after 2 SMCs, no shorts. Known-good DC-In/cable (3). Any ideas? Am I missing something "further up" in the power-on sequence? Not having the proper block diagram makes it harder for me on these boards. All help appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, No Green Light, PPBUS 8.17v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, No Green Light, PPBUS 8.17v
threads.message: SMC is not running. Check 3V42 rail and do a manual SMC reset with power applied and see if the light comes on. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> is high I assume?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, No Green Light, PPBUS 8.17v
threads.message:
Hey Duke, yes, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is high. I'll try a manual reset now--thanks!

Also, 3v42 is present and steady with no short; <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is present and steady at ISL.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, No Green Light, PPBUS 8.17v
threads.message: edit: no change after SMC manual reset.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, No Green Light, PPBUS 8.17v
threads.message: Well, the SMC is not running for some reason. Maybe a power issue to SMC or the Xtal/caps. It is an Apple refurb board so expect it to be trash.
